issue.title: Objects colliding only with mesh edges.

content.raw:
I noticed that the issue happens when the inertia matrix has smaller (more realistic) values, meaning the sphere is able to roll.

In the `collision_test.world` if we set the inertia to larger values ~ 0.1 then the sphere does not roll, and does not fall through the mesh. 

If the inertia value is smaller than ~0.0001 the sphere starts rolling and it goes through the mesh, however not if it collides with edges. Meaning, if we increase the size of the sphere we can see that it collides with the mesh edges.
